When Bush first became president, the news media was reporting about things like his brush clearing in Texas, and the O.J Simpson trial and who murdered JonBenét Ramsey and was Susan Smith a terrible mother. content: Aside from the obvious - I don't HAVE a TV - was there ever a day Bush wasn't on TV? He's the PRESIDENT, for heaven's sake. The Prez - whoever he/she is - is always on TV. If you go to the UK, the PM is on everyday. What do you expect?

content: Well at least they are talking about real world stuff. When Bush first became president, the news media was reporting about things like his brush clearing in Texas, and the O.J Simpson trial and who murdered JonBenét Ramsey and was Susan Smith a terrible mother. The biggest heroes in America were movie stars and athletes - Madonna, Michael Jackson, and Michael Jordan. The biggest concern seemed to be - Who will become the next American Idol?

content: quote: Originally posted by Cider33_Alpha: Aside from the obvious - I don't HAVE a TV - was there ever a day Bush wasn't on TV? He's the PRESIDENT, for heaven's sake. The Prez - whoever he/she is - is always on TV. If you go to the UK, the PM is on everyday. What do you expect? Exactly. Bush was on TV every single freakin day of his eight years in office ... except maybe Sunday. I know -- I used to change the channel every time his mug and voice invaded my air space. By 2005, it had become a simple reflex action. That said, if President Obama affects your sanity, then just change the channel. In a few years, I bet it'll become a simple reflex action for you, too!
